section.para: And finally, between a jek (or joik) and bo, as in:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi mikce jebabo ricfu
interlinear-gloss.en: I am a doctor and future rich person.

section.para: As can be seen from and , the choice between bo and ke (or tu'e) is arbitrary when there are only two things to be connected. If there were no tense information to include, of course neither would be required; it is only the rule that tense information must always be sandwiched between the logical connective and a following bo, ke, or tu'e that requires the use of one of these grouping cmavo in and through .

Non-logical connectives with bo and ke can include tense information in exactly the same way as logical connectives. Forethought connectives, however (except as noted below) are unable to do so, as are termsets or tense connectives. Mathematical operands and operators can also include tense information in their logical connectives as a result of their close parallelism with sumti and tanru components respectively:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: vei ci .ebabo vo [ve'o] tadni cu zvati le kumfa
interlinear-gloss.en: Three and, later, four students were in the room.

section.para: is a simple example. There is a special grammatical rule for use when a tense applies to both of the selbri in a forethought bridi-tail connection: the entire forethought construction can just be preceded by a tense. For example:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi pu ge klama le zarci gi tervecnu lo cidja
interlinear-gloss.gloss: I [past] both go-to the market and buy some food
interlinear-gloss.en: I went to the market and bought some food.

section.para: is similar to . There is no time relationship specified between the going and the buying; both are simply set in the past.

section.title: Abstractor connection and connection within abstractions
section.para:
Last and (as a matter of fact) least: a logical connective is allowed between abstraction markers of selma'o NU. As usual, the connection can be expanded to a bridi connection between two bridi which differ only in abstraction marker. Jeks are the appropriate connective.

and are equivalent in meaning:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: le ka la frank. ciska cu xlali .ije le ni la frank. ciska cu xlali
interlinear-gloss.en: The quality-of Frank's writing is bad, and the quantity of Frank's writing is bad.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: le ka je ni la frank. ciska cu xlali
interlinear-gloss.en: The quality and quantity of Frank's writing is bad.

section.para: As with tenses and modals, there is no forethought and no way to override the left-grouping rule.

Logical connectives and abstraction are related in another way as well, though. Since an abstraction contains a bridi, the bridi may have a logical connection inside it. Is it legitimate to split the outer bridi into two, joined by the logical connection? Absolutely not. For example:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi jinvi le du'u loi jmive cu zvati gi'onai na zvati vau la .iupiter.
interlinear-gloss.gloss: I opine the fact-that a-mass-of living-things (is-at or-else isn't-at) Jupiter.
interlinear-gloss.en: I believe there either is or isn't life on Jupiter.

section.para: is true, since the embedded sentence is a tautology, but:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi jinvi le du'u loi jmive cu zvati la .iupiter.
interlinear-gloss.gloss: .ijonai mi jinvi le du'u loi jmive cu zvati la .iupiter.
I opine the fact-that a-mass-of living-things is-at Jupiter

section.para: is false, since I have no evidence one way or the other ( jinvi requires some sort of evidence, real or fancied, unlike krici).

section.para: The following table specifies, for each truth function, the most-often used cmavo or compound cmavo which expresses it for each of the six types of logical connective. (Other compound cmavo are often possible: for example, se.a means the same as a, and could be used instead.)

section.title: Rules for making logical and non-logical connectives
section.para: The full set of rules for inserting na, se, and nai into any connective is:
Afterthought logical connectives (eks, jeks, giheks, ijeks):

listitem.para: Negate first construct: Place na before the connective cmavo (but after the .i of an ijek).
Negate second construct: Place nai after the connective cmavo.
Exchange constructs: Place se before the connective cmavo (after na if any).

section.para: Forethought logical connectives (geks, guheks):

listitem.para: Negate first construct: Place nai after the connective cmavo.
Negate second construct: Place nai after the gi.
Exchange constructs: Place se before the connective cmavo.

section.para: Non-logical connectives (joiks, joigiks):

listitem.para: Negate connection: Place nai after the connective cmavo (but before the gi of a joigik).
Exchange constructs: Place se before the connective cmavo.
